reviews.review_msg: Good prof. Very knowledgable about his field and other social science perspectives. Expects a lot, but respects his students. Also, he is very funny.

I think  your experience with Checkel depends on whether your personalities fit. I found him entertaining and thought he was great at getting the material across (especially such dry material as research methods). He is certainly a unique personality, and I think that puts off some people who are used to conventional lectures. I would recommend!

Checkel's classes are well structured. He is a very hard marker and the class has too many readings (150200+ pages per week from multiple sources when he could easily reduce it by half). I didn't like his style of lecturing, so I didn't enjoy lectures. However, I found his assignments to be clear in terms of criteria and expectations.

Checkel is eccentric, but he is extremely passionate about what he teaches, which is engaging at 8:30 in the morning. He doesn't have unreasonable expectations, just that you show up and engage in discussion. He is a tough grader, but fair. I would certainly recommend taking him, but if you are looking for a class to coast through, his is not it.

Prof Pang is a brilliant (and best) teacher who is aware of the best pedagogical approaches and cares for her students. There is a relevance of what we learn to our lives and practices, she has taught us how to be a better consumer of knowledge and a better producer of knowledge. She is a tough grader but gives clear feedback and you learn a lot.

Not great at teaching, but she's open to suggestions & will change something if the majority of the class is in agreement. This course is dry, v heavy & she lectures for the entire four hours online. Offers bonus points, but is a tough grader and her marking can be unclear. If you're not keen on talking in class she won't force you.

I think I learned a lot in this class. Lots of readings required, but interesting and worthwhile. Grading was curved which was nice since she's a tough marker. I don't feel she's the most effective professor and sometimes made the concepts confusing to understand. She's also quite the stickler for keeping cameras on.

Professor Pang is an amazing prof who cares about her students and is quite accessible for support outside class as well. I enjoyed her teaching style as she delivered great lectures that were engaging. Shes a tough marker so be aware of that, however, be on top of the readings and assignments and you should be fine.

One of the worst courses I've taken at SFU. Clearly has no idea how to teach, asks for feedback and then is rude/refuses to implement, can't keep up with the workload she assigns, gives no criteria for assignments, has no rubric and relies on a check mark system she refused to explain. Most unclear syllabus I've seen in 5 years, wish I could give 0

I cannot express the trauma I sustained from this class. We spent all semester working on a group research proposal except the group was the whole class. Yes there were 34 of us contributing to a single document. Almost an hour of every lecture was spent asking her what was going on. I still dont know how were getting graded. Im so confused.

Im writing this to warn people choosing classes soon. This professor isnt tough because of difficult lecture and course content, but cuz her instructing skills are so poor. Doesnt know how to create a proper rubric or give proper feedback. Everything is unclear and confusing + still marked very hard  impossible to do well. Being as fair as I can.
